remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供在阻止模式下通过 套接字发送和接收数据的方法。The class provides methods for sending and receiving data over sockets in blocking mode. 有关阻止和非阻止 s 的详细信息，请参阅[使用异步客户端套接字](~/docs/framework/network-programming/using-an-asynchronous-client-socket.md)。For more information about blocking versus nonblocking s, see [Using an Asynchronous Client Socket](~/docs/framework/network-programming/using-an-asynchronous-client-socket.md). 可以将 类用于同步和异步数据传输。You can use the class for both synchronous and asynchronous data transfer. 有关同步和异步通信的详细信息，请参阅[套接字](~/docs/framework/network-programming/sockets.md)。For more information about synchronous and asynchronous communication, see [Sockets](~/docs/framework/network-programming/sockets.md). 若要创建 ，你必须提供连接的 。To create a , you must provide a connected . 你还可以指定 对提供 的 权限。You can also specify what permission the has over the provided . 默认情况下，关闭 不会关闭提供的 。By default, closing the does not close the provided . 如果希望 有权关闭提供的 ，则必须指定 `ownsSocket` 参数的值 `true`。If you want the to have permission to close the provided , you must specify `true` for the value of the `ownsSocket` parameter. 将 和 方法用于简单的单线程同步阻塞 i/o。Use the and methods for simple single thread synchronous blocking I/O. 如果要使用单独的线程处理 i/o，请考虑使用 和 方法，或者使用 和 方法进行通信。If you want to process your I/O using separate threads, consider using the and methods, or the and methods for communication. 不支持对网络数据流进行随机访问。The does not support random access to the network data stream. 属性的值，该值指示流是否支持查找，始终 `false`;读取 属性、读取 属性或调用 方法将引发 。The value of the property, which indicates whether the stream supports seeking, is always `false`; reading the property, reading the property, or calling the method will throw a . 可以在 类的实例上同时执行读写操作，而无需进行同步。Read and write operations can be performed simultaneously on an instance of the class without the need for synchronization. 只要有一个唯一的线程用于写入操作，另一个线程用于读取操作，读取和写入线程之间就不会有交叉干扰，也不需要进行同步。As long as there is one unique thread for the write operations and one unique thread for the read operations, there will be no cross-interference between read and write threads and no synchronization is required. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何从连接的 创建 并执行基本的同步阻塞 i/o。The following code example demonstrates how to create a from a connected and perform basic synchronous blocking I/O. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法开始从传入网络缓冲区中异步读取数据。The method starts asynchronously reading data from the incoming network buffers. 调用 方法使你能够在单独的执行线程中接收数据。Calling the method gives you the ability to receive data within a separate execution thread. 必须创建实现 委托的回调方法，并将其名称传递到 方法。You must create a callback method that implements the delegate and pass its name to the method. 最少的 `state` 参数必须包含 。At the very minimum, your `state` parameter must contain the . 由于你将需要在回调方法中获取收到的数据，因此，你应创建一个小型类或结构来保存读取缓冲区和其他有用的信息。Because you will want to obtain the received data within your callback method, you should create a small class or structure to hold a read buffer and any other useful information. 通过 `state` 参数将结构或类实例传递到 方法。Pass the structure or class instance to the method through the `state` parameter. 回调方法应调用 方法。Your callback method should call the method. 当应用程序调用 时，系统将等待，直到接收到数据或发生错误，然后，系统将使用单独的线程来执行指定的回调方法，并在 上阻止，直到提供的 读取数据或引发异常.When your application calls , the system will wait until data is received or an error occurs, and then the system will use a separate thread to execute the specified callback method, and blocks on until the provided reads data or throws an exception. 如果希望在调用 方法后原始线程被阻止，请使用 方法。If you want the original thread to block after you call the method, use the method. 如果希望原始线程继续执行，请在回调方法中调用 。Call in the callback method when you want the original thread to continue executing. 有关编写回调方法的其他信息，请参阅将[委托作为回调方法进行封送处理](~/docs/framework/interop/marshaling-a-delegate-as-a-callback-method.md)。For additional information about writing callback methods, see [Marshaling a Delegate as a Callback Method](~/docs/framework/interop/marshaling-a-delegate-as-a-callback-method.md). 方法可读取尽可能多的数据，直到 `size` 参数指定的字节数。The method reads as much data as is available, up to the number of bytes specified by the `size` parameter. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到 ，请检查 属性以确定其是否由 引起。If you receive an , check the property to determine if it was caused by a . 如果是这样，请使用 属性来获取特定的错误代码，并参考[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档以获取错误的详细说明。If so, use the property to obtain the specific error code and refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. 可以在 类的实例上同时执行读写操作，而无需进行同步。Read and write operations can be performed simultaneously on an instance of the class without the need for synchronization. 只要有一个唯一的线程用于写入操作，另一个线程用于读取操作，读取和写入线程之间就不会有交叉干扰，也不需要进行同步。As long as there is one unique thread for the write operations and one unique thread for the read operations, there will be no cross-interference between read and write threads and no synchronization is required. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用 从网络流异步读取数据。The following code example uses to read data asynchronously from the network stream. `myReadCallBack` 方法实现 委托，并在 返回时由系统调用。The `myReadCallBack` method implements the delegate and is called by the system when returns. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法完成 方法中启动的异步读取操作。The method completes the asynchronous read operation started in the method. 在调用 之前，需要创建实现 委托的回调方法。Before calling , you need to create a callback method that implements the delegate. 此回调方法在单独的线程中执行，并在 返回后由系统调用。This callback method executes in a separate thread and is called by the system after returns. 回调方法必须接受从 方法返回的 作为参数。The callback method must accept the returned from the method as a parameter. 在回调方法中，调用 的 属性以获取传递给 方法的状态对象。Within the callback method, call the property of the to obtain the state object passed to the method. 从此状态对象中提取接收 。Extract the receiving from this state object. 获取 后，调用 方法以成功完成读取操作并返回读取的字节数。After obtaining the , call the method to successfully complete the read operation and return the number of bytes read. 在数据可用之前，将阻止 方法。The method blocks until data is available. 方法可读取尽可能多的数据，最多可达 方法的 `size` 参数中指定的字节数。The method reads as much data as is available up to the number of bytes specified in the `size` parameter of the method. 如果远程主机关闭 连接并且收到所有可用数据，则 方法会立即完成并返回零字节。If the remote host shuts down the connection and all available data has been received, the method completes immediately and returns zero bytes. 若要获取收到的数据，请调用 的 属性，然后提取所产生状态对象中包含的缓冲区。To obtain the received data, call the property of the , and extract the buffer contained in the resulting state object. > [!NOTE] > 如果收到 ，请检查 属性以确定其是否由 引起。If you receive an , check the property to determine if it was caused by a . 如果是这样，请使用 属性来获取特定的错误代码，并参考[Windows 套接字版本 2 API 错误代码](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2)文档以获取错误的详细说明。If so, use the property to obtain the specific error code and refer to the [Windows Sockets version 2 API error code](/windows/desktop/winsock/windows-sockets-error-codes-2) documentation for a detailed description of the error. ## Examples 在下面的代码示例中，提供了 `myReadCallback` 作为回调方法 。In the following code example, `myReadCallback` is provided to as the callback method. 在 `myReadCallback` 中实现，以完成 启动的异步读取调用。 is implemented in `myReadCallback` to complete the asynchronous read call started by . remarks.format: ## Remarks 在完成使用 `Dispose` 后，应调用 。Call `Dispose` when you are finished using the . `Dispose` 方法使 处于不可用状态。The `Dispose` method leaves the in an unusable state. 调用 `Dispose`后，必须释放对 的所有引用，以便垃圾回收器可以回收 占用的内存。After calling `Dispose`, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying. 有关使用 Dispose 方法的详细信息，请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)和[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。For more information about using the Dispose method, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md). > [!NOTE] > 每次释放对 `Dispose` 的最后一个引用前，均应调用 。Always call `Dispose` before you release your last reference to the . 否则，在垃圾回收器调用 对象的 Finalize 方法之前，不会释放它所使用的资源。Otherwise, the resources it is using are not freed until the garbage collector calls the object's Finalize method.
